thread.section_title: Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo wants to prove Jose Mourinho wrong over Romelu Lukaku – Metro
thread.title: Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo wants to prove Jose Mourinho wrong over Romelu Lukaku
thread.title_full: Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo wants to prove Jose Mourinho wrong over Romelu Lukaku

author: Chris Davie
title: Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo wants to prove Jose Mourinho wrong over Romelu Lukaku
text:
Romelu Lukaku is wanted by Chelsea’s technical director Michael Emenalo. (Getty Images) Part of Chelsea’s desire to re-sign Romelu Lukaku this summer is to prove Jose Mourinho wrong, according to reports.
The Sun claim that Antonio Conte is at odds with Chelsea’s technical director Michael Emenalo over which striker to sign .
Conte is keen on a move for Real Madrid forward Alvaro Morata, having failed to lure the Spaniard to Stamford Bridge last summer .
But Emenalo wants Chelsea to bring Lukaku back from Everton, just three years after he was sold for £28 million.
And The Sun claim Emenalo’s motivation behind wanting Lukaku back at Stamford Bridge is based on the initial decision to let the striker leave under Mourinho.
Mourinho allowed Lukaku to permanently join Everton in 2014. (Getty Images) Emenalo was the man who alerted Chelsea to Lukaku. (AMA/Getty Images) More: Football Wenger fires warning to Chelsea over Sanchez pursuit 
'Only one team in London' - Wenger's Chelsea taunt will come back to haunt Arsenal 
Arsene Wenger backtracks and throws his Arsenal future into further doubt 
Emenalo was the man who alerted Chelsea to Lukaku when the Belgian was at Anderlecht, and is ‘determined’ to be proven right about the striker.
As well as Lukaku, Kevin De Bruyne and David Luiz were also sold during Mourinho’s reign, despite senior figures at the club being against the transfers.
And with Mourinho’s recent comments about United making a mistake by selling Danny Welbeck, Javier Hernandez and Angel Di Maria , it’s claimed figures behind the scenes at Chelsea are ‘enjoying the irony’ of the Portuguese’s comments.
MORE: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho ‘determined’ to make Kylian Mbappe the heir to Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo 
MORE: Manchester United set to hand David De Gea £300,000-a-week deal to reject Real Madrid
